intro: Centaurium spicatum, commonly known as slender centaury, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, with a slightly hairy texture. Centaurium spicatum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
